Primary Executive: Gaelene Askeland, Executive Director, The John Howard Society of the Central and South Okanagan; Phone: 250.763.1331; Email: gaelene.askeland@jhscso.bc.ca
Service Details: - Located in downtown Kelowna, Gateway is an open space where individuals can drop-in as long as doors are open- The Gateway space is an extension of our outreach and community inclusion supports, that supports individuals with disabilities supported through Community Living BC.  At Gateway, people can access:- Free Wi-Fi & computer use- Private bathroom & shower- Laundry- Harm reduction supplies (ex. naloxone kits & condoms)- Gym passes- Bus tickets (as supplies lasts)- Kitchen- Direct access to Connection activities and support workers- Couches- Netflix- Temporary storage- Food deliveries by the Central Okanagan Community Food Bank
Eligibility: Those interested in accessing Gateway program must contact Community Living British Columbia (CLBC) to determine eligibility for the John Howard Society's Outreach + Community Living Services and request service.  CLBC will then coordinate service.
Address & Map: 1456 St. Paul St, Unit 104Kelowna, BCCanada     V1Y 2E6
